tool.name: GlobalKFunction

param.name: network_dataset
param.dialogReference: Network Dataset used to generate the OD Cost Matix

param.name: num_dist_bands
param.dialogReference: The number of concentric circles (or distance bands) from each point to aggregate the number of points within each concentric circle, representing the density of that specific band.

param.name: beginning_distance
param.dialogReference: Distance value of the first concentric circle from the origin point in meters.

param.name: distance_increment
param.dialogReference: How much to increment the distance for each band from the previous band in meters.

param.name: snap_distance
param.dialogReference: If a point is not directly placed on the network, it will be snapped to the nearest line only if the point is within the distance (in meters) that this value represents.

param.name: output_raw_odcm_feature_class
param.dialogReference: Name of the output Raw ODCM data as a feature class

param.name: output_raw_analysis_feature_class
param.displayname: Raw Global-K Data Table (Raw Analysis Data)
param.dialogReference: Output of the raw Cross K Analysis as a feature class

param.name: output_analysis_feature_class
param.dialogReference: Name of the output Global K Analaysis feature class

param.name: num_permutations
param.expression: 0 Permutations (No Confidence Envelope) | 9 Permutations | 99 Permutations | 999 Permutations
param.dialogReference: Number of Random Point Permutations used to generate the OD Cost Matrix

param.name: coordinate_system
param.displayname: Output Network Dataset Length Projected Coordinate System
param.dialogReference: Output Network Dataset Length Projected Coordinate System

param.name: num_points_field
param.dialogReference: Name of a field in the network dataset's edge source from which the number of random points should be derived.

tool.summary:
The Global K Function tool allows the user to find crash clustering and dispersion at different distance bands.

The “Global” analysis type calculates the global statistic to identify the presence or absence of a systematic process, the magnitude, and the extent of spatial patterns in crash data.
tool.usage:
See parameters for description for Required and Optional inputs.

Outputs a table of raw data which is used to generate the Network K Function.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The Global K Function tool allows the user to find crash clustering and dispersion at different distance bands.

The “Global” analysis type calculates the global statistic to identify the presence or absence of a systematic process, the magnitude, and the extent of spatial patterns in crash data.
